programme.title: Voetbalpraatjes
programme.desc: Presentatrice Fresia Cousiño Arias ontvangt drie jonge voetbalvolgers in de setting van Voetbalpraat. Geen tactische analyses of ingewikkelde statistieken, maar voetbal zoals kinderen het beleven: spontaan, vrolijk en enthousiast. Voetbalpraatjes neemt de kijker mee in de voetbalbeleving van kinderen, die onder anderen reageren op stellingen van bekende spelers en speelsters. En in de rubriek "Warmlopers" krijgen kinderen een exclusief kijkje achter de schermen.

programme.title: Voetbalpraatjes
programme.desc: Presentatrice Fresia Cousiño Arias ontvangt drie jonge voetbalvolgers in de setting van Voetbalpraat. Geen tactische analyses of ingewikkelde statistieken, maar voetbal zoals kinderen het beleven: spontaan, vrolijk en enthousiast. Voetbalpraatjes neemt de kijker mee in de voetbalbeleving van kinderen, die onder anderen reageren op stellingen van bekende spelers en speelsters. En in de rubriek "Warmlopers" krijgen kinderen een exclusief kijkje achter de schermen.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Van maandag tot en met vrijdag is oud-NFL-speler Pat McAfee gastheer van een dynamische talkshow waarin alles uit de Amerikaanse sportwereld ter sprake komt. Onder meer A.J. Hawk, Evan Fox, Zito Perez, Connor Campbell, Ty Schmit, Tone Digs, Frank Maraldo, Phil Mains, Casey Tok, Matt Brahn, Michael Girdy, AQ Shipley, Bailey McComas, Mitt McMahon, Coach Chuck Pagano, Aaron Rodgers, Darius Butler en Adam Jones maken hun opwachting in het programma.

programme.title: Unfiltered
programme.desc: Krijg een ​​exclusieve blik achter de schermen op de DP World Tour terwijl we elk Rolex Series-evenement in 2025 van maandag tot en met zondag vastleggen. Unfiltered biedt toegang tot de voorbereidingen van enkele van 's werelds beste golfers, hun interacties met beroemdheden tijdens de populaire Pro-Am, ontmoetingen met vrienden en familie en fascinerende gesprekken, die een onthullend inzicht bieden in het zich ontwikkelende verhaal van een kampioenschapsweek. Bekijk wat er gebeurt buiten de schijnwerpers van de televisiecamera's bij vijf van de meest historische golfevenementen op de DPWorld Tour.

programme.title: Live: Bowl Mania
programme.desc: College football experts offer opinions and betting tips for upcoming bowl games.

programme.title: Live: College Football
programme.desc: The Panthers (10-3) face the Bulldogs (9-3) in the Celebration Bowl from Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta. Prairie View A&M claimed its first Southwestern Athletic Conference championship since 2009 with a 23-21 victory at Jackson State on Dec. 6.

programme.title: Live: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 3 Grizzlies (12-1) go for a South Dakota sweep as they host the No. 11 Coyotes (10-4) in an FCS quarterfinal. Montana amassed 552 yards of offense in a 50-29 second-round victory over South Dakota State. South Dakota won at Mercer 47-0.

programme.title: Live: Heisman Trophy Ceremony
programme.desc: The 90th ceremony, honoring college football's most outstanding player, will announce the winner from finalists Dillon Gabriel (Oregon), Travis Hunter (Colorado), Ashton Jeanty (Boise State) and Cam Ward (Miami). From New York City.

programme.title: Live: College Football
programme.desc: The Huskies (8-4) and Broncos (9-4) clash in the LA Bowl. Mountain West champ Boise State is back in the bowl circuit after falling in the CFP quarterfinals last year. Washington beat Boise State 38-7 in the 2019 Las Vegas Bowl, and 56-19 in 2023.

programme.title: Live: NFL Countdown

programme.title: Live: NFL Football
programme.desc: The Ravens (6-7) attempt to avenge a loss to the AFC North rival Bengals (4-9) as they meet in Ohio. On Nov. 27, Joe Burrow returned after missing 10 weeks due to surgery on his turf toe to lead Cincinnati to a 32-14 road rout of Baltimore.

programme.title: Live: NFL Football
programme.desc: The Rams (10-3) host the Lions (8-5) for a crucial contest that will help shape the NFC playoff landscape. Los Angeles is tied with Seattle for first in the NFC West and best record in the conference. Detroit sits one game out of postseason position.

programme.title: Live: Football Night in America
programme.desc: "Football Night in America" features host Maria Taylor, Hall of Fame head coach Tony Dungy, former NFL head coach and quarterback Jason Garrett, former NFL quarterback Chris Simms and NFL insider Mike Florio recapping the day's NFL highlights. Co-host Jac Collinsworth and two-time Super Bowl champion Rodney Harrison contribute on-site each week.

programme.title: Live: NFL Football
programme.desc: The Cowboys continue their playoff push by hosting the Vikings on Sunday Night Football. J.J. McCarthy connected with Josh Oliver for a pair of TDs as Minnesota blanked Washington 31-0 to snap a four-game skid and stay above the NFC elimination zone.

programme.desc: The latest scores and highlights, with host Jay Onrait.

programme.title: The Grizzlie Truth
programme.desc: Superfan filmmaker Kat Jayme investigates the abrupt move of her NBA hometown team, the Vancouver Grizzlies, to Memphis in 2001. Much more than a sore spot, it's an unsolved mystery and possibly a criminal conspiracy. The investigation becomes a love letter to the worst professional sports franchise in history and an exploration into the deep roots of fandom.

programme.title: The 109th Running of the Indianapolis 500
programme.desc: The IndyCar Series runs its crown jewel event, the 109th Indianapolis 500. Despite three series titles and 15 wins, including four this year, Álex Palou looks to kiss the bricks for the first time. Josef Newgarden is the two-time defending champion.

programme.title: 100 Days to Indy
programme.desc: For multiple drivers heading into the 2025 Indy 500, this is the moment they've been waiting 365 days for. Everyone behind the wheel is looking to fight off past ghosts. After a second place finish in '22 and '24, can O Ward finally kiss the bricks? Is it time for Dixon to get his second victory after nearly two decades? Will Larson pull off the double after the weather derailed him a year ago? There have never been more questions looking to be answered at the Indianapolis 500.

programme.title: Live: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: Live: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Live: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Hudson Square in Lower Manhattan, a modern media hub for ESPN and The Walt Disney Company's New York-based teams. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: Live: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith hosts this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: Live: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: An NFL Films production, "NFL Matchup" is definitely a show for football junkies. Unlike traditional football preview programs, this one gives fans an in-depth look at some of Sunday's games by breaking down the strategy and tactics -- the Xs and Os -- through the exclusive use of team-supplied footage. That type of film study is a forte of former NFL player and executive Louis Riddick and NFL Films producer Greg Cosell, whose work is featured here alongside host Sal Paolantonio.

programme.title: Live: SportsCenter
programme.desc: Las últimas noticias, momentos destacados e información de todos los rincones del mundo del deporte se presenta cada día en "SportsCenter", el primer programa de ESPN cuando la red se estrenó en septiembre de 1979. La serie se transmite en tres ediciones nocturnas, luego se re-transmite la última edición cuatro veces cada mañana de lunes a viernes antes de despejar el escenario para un bloque de seis horas de "SportsCenter" en vivo, que pone más énfasis en la interactividad de los fanáticos, noticias, análisis, comentarios y la cobertura de las conferencias de prensa.

programme.desc: La mesa más picante discute las últimas novedades del fútbol mexicano y analiza la actuación de los futbolistas mexicanos en el exterior.

La serie se transmite en tres ediciones nocturnas, luego se re-transmite la última edición cuatro veces cada mañana de lunes a viernes antes de despejar el escenario para un bloque de seis horas de "SportsCenter" en vivo, que pone más énfasis en la interactividad de los fanáticos, noticias, análisis, comentarios y la cobertura de las conferencias de prensa.

programme.title: Call to Earth
programme.desc: Our waterways often bear the brunt of modern-day human negligence. Most of India's ponds, lakes and oceans are polluted or contaminated due to human activity. Led by founder Arun Krishnamurthy, Environmentalist Foundation of India (EFI) focuses on reviving these bodies of water through a community-based conservation effort, with their work now extending into the surrounding forest ecosystems.

programme.title: Call to Earth
programme.desc: Our waterways often bear the brunt of modern-day human negligence. Most of India's ponds, lakes and oceans are polluted or contaminated due to human activity. Led by founder Arun Krishnamurthy, Environmentalist Foundation of India (EFI) focuses on reviving these bodies of water through a community-based conservation effort, with their work now extending into the surrounding forest ecosystems.

programme.title: Fareed Zakaria GPS
programme.desc: Host, columnist, and best-selling author Fareed Zakaria offers insightful analysis and interviews world leaders, artists, scientists, business leaders, global affairs analysts, and other cultural observers for the "Global Public Square." Zakaria is also a syndicated columnist for The Washington Post, a contributing editor for The Atlantic magazine, and hosts in-depth, prime-time specials for CNN Worldwide. "Fareed Zakaria GPS" was launched in 2008 and each week's program airs worldwide on CNN, from New York or other locations around the world. The program is characterized by smart debate and discussion on world events and public affairs, designed to help viewers understand the world around them and the newest thinking on the globe's biggest challenges.

programme.title: Miss Congeniality 2: Armed and Fabulous
programme.desc: Gracie Hart (Sandra Bullock) was never thrilled to have to go undercover as a competitor in a beauty pageant. Now Gracie, who works for the FBI, is dealing with some very public attention thanks to her waltz down the runway. Her overnight celebrity does not impress her new partner, Sam Fuller (Regina King). But the pair has to put aside their differences when one of Gracie's former beauty queen pals, Cheryl Frasier (Heather Burns), turns up missing, and the FBI is put on the case.

programme.title: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
programme.desc: In 1950s London, a widowed cleaning lady falls madly in love with a couture Dior dress, deciding she must have one of her own. She tells the neurotic and middle-aged misanthrope that he is the father of a teenager named Claire (Isabella Amara). Shocked, excited and hopeful, Wilson embarks on a madcap quest to connect with the daughter he never knew he had.

programme.title: Oh, God!
programme.desc: Jerry Landers (John Denver), an assistant manager in a supermarket, receives a visit from God (George Burns), who appears in the form of an old man. Reluctant at first, Jerry agrees to spread the word about his visits from the almighty creator of heaven and earth. However, Jerry's wife, Bobbie (Teri Garr), is skeptical, and theologians think Jerry's God is a fake. As Jerry continues to receive visits from God, religious authorities take action and demand that he prove his story.

programme.title: Wings of Desire

When Damiel falls in love with lonely trapeze artist Marion (Solveig Dommartin), the angel longs to experience life in the physical world, and finds--with some words of wisdom from actor Peter Falk (playing himself) -- that it might be possible for him to take human form.

programme.title: Monty Python's Life of Brian
programme.desc: Brian Cohen (Graham Chapman) is an average young Jewish man, but through a series of ridiculous events, he gains a reputation as the Messiah. When he's not dodging his followers or being scolded by his shrill mother (Terry Jones), the hapless Brian has to contend with the pompous Pontius Pilate (Michael Palin) and acronym-obsessed members of a separatist movement. Rife with Monty Python's signature absurdity, the tale finds Brian's life paralleling Biblical lore, albeit with many more laughs.

programme.title: The Power of Film

The two decide to skip town, but before they can, Vincent and his thugs abduct Gloria, and Davey is forced to search for her among the most squalid corners of the city, with his enemy hiding in the shadows.

programme.title: The Harder They Fall

While Toro is beastly in appearance, he has no actual boxing talent, and all his fights are fixed. programme.title: The Big Cube

When Winthrop dies unexpectedly, Johnny convinces Lisa that Adriana murdered him, and together they conspire to drive her insane by lacing her sleeping pills with LSD.

programme.title: Easy to Love
programme.desc: At the Cypress Gardens Resort in Florida, Julie Hallerton (Esther Williams) stars in a show managed by Ray Lloyd (Van Johnson), yet also does other menial work for a shockingly low salary. Frustrated when Ray demands that she work late one night, Julie announces her engagement to her partner, Hank (John Bromfield), stunning Ray, who hastily asks her to accompany him to New York. There, Julie ends up working long hours again, until she meets singer Barry Gordon (Tony Martin), who romances her.

programme.title: Thrill of a Romance
programme.desc: Cynthia Glenn (Esther Williams), a beautiful swimming teacher, marries Robert (Carleton G. Young), a dull but wealthy white-collar worker. The couple travels to the scenic Sierra Nevada Mountains for their honeymoon, but Robert's work gets in the way of romance, and he leaves on a business trip. Before long, Thomas (Van Johnson), a distinguished serviceman on vacation, catches Cynthia's eye -- and the more she gets to know the soldier, the more she wishes she hadn't married Robert.

programme.title: Cash on Demand
programme.desc: A British banker (Peter Cushing) pretends to cooperate with a would-be robber (Andre Morell) holding his wife and son.

programme.title: Holiday Affair
programme.desc: Charming seasonal clerk Steve Mason (Robert Mitchum) catches beautiful Connie Ennis (Janet Leigh) in a fraudulent shopping scheme during the busy Christmas rush. But when he discovers that Ennis is a war widow and single mother, Mason takes pity on her and can't bring himself to turn her in. His supervisor takes notice and fires him on the spot. Mason befriends Connie and her young son, Timmy (Gordon Gebert), and may complicate her plans to marry boring nice guy Carl Davis (Wendell Corey).

programme.title: In the Good Old Summertime
programme.desc: In this musical romance, lovely Veronica Fisher (Judy Garland) lands a job in Otto Oberkugen's (S.Z. Sakall) music store in turn-of-the-century Chicago. Though the other employees like her, including Otto's clumsy nephew Hickey (Buster Keaton), salesman Andrew Larkin (Van Johnson) -- who is threatened by her competition, and secretly attracted to her -- greets her coolly. Each of them is carrying on a romantic correspondence with an as-yet-to-be-met pen pal. They are both in for a surprise.

programme.title: The Shop Around the Corner
programme.desc: Alfred Kralik (James Stewart) and Klara Novak (Margaret Sullavan) are employees at Matuschek and Company, a general store in Budapest. Klara and Alfred are constantly at odds with each other, butting heads and disagreeing on almost everything. Both are enamored of their respective pen pals, who serve as welcome distractions in their lives. Little do they know, they are each the other's pen pal and, despite outward differences, have unwittingly fallen in love through their letters.

rating.system: Departamento de Justiça, Classificação, Títulos e Qualificação

programme.title: Meet Me in St. Louis
programme.desc: "Meet Me in St. Louis" is a classic MGM romantic musical comedy that focuses on four sisters (one of whom is the nonpareil Judy Garland) on the cusp of the 1904 St. Louis World's Fair. The film spotlights the sisters' education in the ways of the world, which includes, but isn't limited to, learning about life and love, courtesy of the prototypical boy next door. In the end, love -- accompanied by song, dance and period costumes, all in glorious Technicolor -- conquers all.

programme.title: The Gold Rush
programme.desc: In this classic silent comedy, the Little Tramp (Charles Chaplin) heads north to join in the Klondike gold rush. Trapped in a small cabin by a blizzard, the Tramp is forced to share close quarters with a successful prospector (Mack Swain) and a fugitive (Tom Murray). Eventually able to leave the cabin, he falls for a lovely barmaid (Georgia Hale), trying valiantly to win her affections. When the prospector needs help locating his claim, it appears the Tramp's fortunes may change.

programme.title: The Great Dictator
programme.desc: After dedicated service in the Great War, a Jewish barber (Charles Chaplin) spends years in an army hospital recovering from his wounds, unaware of the simultaneous rise of fascist dictator Adenoid Hynkel (also Chaplin) and his anti-Semitic policies. When the barber, who bears a remarkable resemblance to Hynkel, returns to his quiet neighborhood, he is stunned by the brutal changes and recklessly joins a beautiful girl (Paulette Goddard) and her neighbors in rebelling.

programme.title: Scar of Shame

programme.title: Watership Down
programme.desc: When a young rabbit named Fiver (Richard Briers) has a prophetic vision that the end of his warren is near, he persuades seven other rabbits to leave with him in search of a new home. Several obstacles impede their progress, including predators, a rat-filled cemetery and a speeding river. Upon arriving at their final destination, a hill dubbed Watership Down, the rabbits find that their journey is still far from over. Realistically drawn, this British animated film carries an emotional weight.

programme.title: Fantastic Planet
programme.desc: This animated tale follows the relationship between the small human-like Oms and their much larger blue-skinned oppressors, the Draags, who rule the planet of Ygam. While the Draags have long kept Oms as illiterate pets, this hierarchy shifts after an Om boy becomes educated, thanks to a young female Draag. This leads to an Om rebellion, which weakens the Draag control over their race. Will the Oms and the Draags find a way to coexist? Or will they destroy each other?

programme.title: The Incredible Mr. Limpet
programme.desc: Aquatic life fanatic Henry Limpet (Don Knotts) falls into the sea and transforms into a fish, quickly becoming pals with a crab and developing a romantic bond with a fetching female fish. As a human, Henry was passed over for naval service. But now that he's a fish, he seeks out his friend Lt. George Stickel (Jack Weston). Finding him on a small boat in the Atlantic, Henry explains that he can alert sailors when enemy ships are close by, and soon he's helping America win World War II.

programme.title: The Unsinkable Molly Brown
programme.desc: Molly Brown (Debbie Reynolds) is determined to rise from her country roots and marry a rich man. She finds one in Johnny Brown (Harve Presnell), who's just sold off his lucrative claim on a Colorado silver mine. With the cash hidden in a stove, Molly accidentally burns it. But Johnny soon strikes it rich in gold, making the pair Denver royalty. But money doesn't ensure happiness and, with their union on the rocks, Molly travels to Europe -- before making an eventful return trip on the Titanic.

programme.title: It's Tough to Be Famous
programme.desc: Naval captain Scott McClenahan (Douglas Fairbanks Jr.) is on a doomed submarine, and he and his mates seem to be facing certain death. He sends them to the surface and sacrifices himself only to be saved at the last minute. McClenahan becomes an instant celebrity for his heroics, and hordes of admirers and lavish parties enter his life. McClenahan never wanted this fame, merely wishing to live a happy life with new wife, Janet (Mary Brian) -- but the media frenzy could ruin their domestic bliss.

programme.title: Here Comes the Navy
programme.desc: After Chesty O'Connor (James Cagney), a pugnacious shipyard worker, loses a girl to a dapper sailor named Biff Martin (Pat O'Brien), he impetuously decides to join the navy to pursue his grudge. Struggling with the navy's idea of discipline, Chesty soon makes a long list of enemies, but unexpectedly finds a friend in Biff's pretty sister, Dorothy (Gloria Stuart). But Biff is understandably suspicious of his intentions, so Chesty will have to prove his worth with some considerable panache.

programme.title: Rogue's March

programme.title: Hero at Large

programme.title: Local Hero

Sent by his colorful boss (Burt Lancaster) to the small village of Ferness, Mac is looking to quickly buy out the townspeople so his company can build a new refinery. But after a taste of country life Mac begins to question whether he is on the right side of this transaction.

Unfortunately, a cutthroat competitor keeps stealing his ideas. That cannot happen on his next commission, a rush job for a big-time theater chain. If his work impresses, it'll lead to an exclusive contract. Chester has only three days, but with the help of his smitten secretary, Nan (Joan Blondell), he just might pull it off.

programme.title: Gold Diggers of 1933
programme.desc: Things get tough for Carol (Joan Blondell) and her showgirl pals (Ruby Keeler, Aline MacMahon) when the Great Depression kicks in and all the Broadway shows close down. Wealthy songwriter Brad (Dick Powell) saves the day by funding a new Depression-themed musical for the girls to star in, but when his stuffy high-society brother finds out and threatens to disown Brad, Carol and her gold-digging friends scheme to keep the show going, hooking a couple of millionaires along the way.

programme.title: NYC Innovates

programme.title: NYC Revealed
programme.desc: New York has long been known as one of the rattiest cities in the U.S., with some estimating close to two million rodents roam its streets; both city workers and residents have been waging a never-ending battle against these four-legged fiends.

programme.title: NYC Revealed
programme.desc: The yellow taxi cab is the quintessential New York City ride; what started as a small fleet of cars nearly 100 years ago, has turned into a bustling system of thousands of yellow taxi cabs.

programme.title: NYC Revealed
programme.desc: Many things come to mind when thinking about New York City, but how the city deals with its garbage is usually not one of them; New Yorkers produce over 14 million tons of trash each year.

programme.title: NYC Revealed
programme.desc: Underneath the ground of New York's fabled streets exists a vast network of pipes that make up the city's sewer system; New Yorkers create, on average, 1.3 billion gallons of wastewater per day that makes its way through these 7,500 miles of pipes.

programme.title: Alternative Investments
programme.desc: Explore the allure and rising momentum of gold as an alternative investment, especially as prices soar to all-time highs; from ancient empires to modern portfolios, discover why gold continues to shine as a hedge against inflation.

programme.title: Business of Beauty

Formuła 1: Grand Prix Abu Zabi
programme.desc: Gdy wydawało się, że kwestia tego, kto zostanie nowym mistrzem świata, będzie wewnętrzną sprawą kierowców McLarena, finisz tegorocznego cyklu niespodziewanie nabrał rumieńców. Konstrukcyjna wpadka brytyjskiego zespołu doprowadziła do dyskwalifikacji Landa Norrisa i Oscara Piastriego w GP Las Vegas. Dzięki temu Max Verstappen zyskał realną szansę, by na ostatniej prostej wyprzedzić swoich głównych rywali w wyścigu o tytuł. W wieńczących sezon zmaganiach w ZEA przekonamy się, czy pogoń Holendra zakończy się spektakularnym sukcesem.

Liga niemiecka - mecz: VfB Stuttgart - FC Bayern Monachium
Liga włoska - mecz: SSC Napoli - Juventus FC
programme.desc: Bianconeri od 2019 roku nie ograli Napoli na wyjeździe. W bieżącym sezonie przekroczyli już jednak limit potknięć i muszą pokusić się o przerwanie złej serii. Październikowa porażka Juventusu z Lazio przypieczętowała zwolnienie trenera Igora Tudora. Zastąpił go Luciano Spalletti, który rozpoczął swoją kadencję od triumfu nad Cremonese oraz remisów z Torino i Fiorentiną. Spotkanie z mistrzem Włoch będzie dla niego najtrudniejszym z dotychczasowych testów, także z powodów sentymentalnych. Spaletti pracował w ekipie spod Wezuwiusza w latach 2021-2023, sięgając z nią po Puchar Włoch.

programme.title: Liga włoska - mecz: Genoa CFC - Inter Mediolan
Liga włoska - mecz: Bologna FC - Juventus FC
Formuła 1: Grand Prix Abu Zabi
programme.desc: Gdy wydawało się, że kwestia tego, kto zostanie nowym mistrzem świata, będzie wewnętrzną sprawą kierowców McLarena, finisz tegorocznego cyklu niespodziewanie nabrał rumieńców. Konstrukcyjna wpadka brytyjskiego zespołu doprowadziła do dyskwalifikacji Landa Norrisa i Oscara Piastriego w GP Las Vegas. Dzięki temu Max Verstappen zyskał realną szansę, by na ostatniej prostej wyprzedzić swoich głównych rywali w wyścigu o tytuł. W wieńczących sezon zmaganiach w ZEA przekonamy się, czy pogoń Holendra zakończy się spektakularnym sukcesem.

programme.title: Byłem królem
programme.desc: Seria przybliżająca sylwetki najlepszych strzelców w historii piłkarskiej ekstraklasy. To wspaniała okazja do przypomnienia sobie sukcesów Włodzimierza Lubańskiego, Grzegorza Laty, Kazimierza Kmiecika, Grzegorza Piechny i Tomasza Frankowskiego. Poznamy różne piłkarskie pokolenia. W latach 60. XX wieku cztery raz z rzędu królem strzelców był Włodzimierz Lubański (Górnik Zabrze). Natomiast w latach 70. królowali Kazimierz Kmiecik (Wisła Kraków) i Grzegorz Lato (Stal Mielec). W czasach bardziej współczesnych cztery tytuły na koncie zanotował Tomasz Frankowski w barwach Wisły Kraków i Jagiellonii Białystok. Nie zabraknie też historii Grzegorza Piechny, niespodziewanego króla strzelców z Korony Kielce w 2006 roku.

programme.title: Byłem królem
programme.desc: Seria przybliżająca sylwetki najlepszych strzelców w historii piłkarskiej ekstraklasy. To wspaniała okazja do przypomnienia sobie sukcesów Włodzimierza Lubańskiego, Grzegorza Laty, Kazimierza Kmiecika, Grzegorza Piechny i Tomasza Frankowskiego. Poznamy różne piłkarskie pokolenia. W latach 60. XX wieku cztery raz z rzędu królem strzelców był Włodzimierz Lubański (Górnik Zabrze). Natomiast w latach 70. królowali Kazimierz Kmiecik (Wisła Kraków) i Grzegorz Lato (Stal Mielec). W czasach bardziej współczesnych cztery tytuły na koncie zanotował Tomasz Frankowski w barwach Wisły Kraków i Jagiellonii Białystok. Telesprzedaż
programme.desc: Prezentacja atrakcyjnych produktów codziennego użytku, które można kupić nie wychodząc z domu.

programme.title: Premier League Stories
programme.desc: Historie piłkarzy, trenerów, zespołów, a także sędziów jednej z największych lig na świecie. Poznamy nieznane wcześniej fakty. Przybliżone zostaną sylwetki prawdziwych legend rozgrywek Premier League.

programme.title: Premier League: The Big Interview
programme.desc: Trenerzy oraz zawodnicy, których możemy oglądać na boiskach Premier League, przybliżą perspektywę na boiskowe wydarzenia, opowiedzą o drodze na sam szczyt i pierwszych chwilach w nowych zespołach.

programme.title: Liga+ Extra
programme.desc: Krzysztof Marciniak i Bartosz Gleń podsumowują ostatnią kolejkę Ekstraklasy. W magazynie nie zabraknie bramek i rozmów z gośćmi. Przy jego tworzeniu współpracować będzie m.in.: Daria Kabała-Malarz.

programme.title: Piłka nożna: PKO BP Ekstraklasa - mecz: Lechia Gdańsk - Górnik Zabrze
Piłka nożna: PKO BP Ekstraklasa - mecz: Cracovia - Lech Poznań
Żużel: PGE Ekstraliga - mecz: PRES Grupa Deweloperska Toruń - Stelmet Falubaz Zielona Góra
Premier League Preview
programme.desc: Zapowiedź wszystkich spotkań nadchodzącej kolejki angielskiej Premier League.

programme.title: Byłem królem
programme.desc: Seria przybliżająca sylwetki najlepszych strzelców w historii piłkarskiej ekstraklasy. To wspaniała okazja do przypomnienia sobie sukcesów Włodzimierza Lubańskiego, Grzegorza Laty, Kazimierza Kmiecika, Grzegorza Piechny i Tomasza Frankowskiego. Poznamy różne piłkarskie pokolenia. W latach 60. XX wieku cztery raz z rzędu królem strzelców był Włodzimierz Lubański (Górnik Zabrze). Natomiast w latach 70. królowali Kazimierz Kmiecik (Wisła Kraków) i Grzegorz Lato (Stal Mielec). W czasach bardziej współczesnych cztery tytuły na koncie zanotował Tomasz Frankowski w barwach Wisły Kraków i Jagiellonii Białystok. Nie zabraknie też historii Grzegorza Piechny, niespodziewanego króla strzelców z Korony Kielce w 2006 roku.

programme.title: Piłka nożna: Liga hiszpańska - mecz: Real Sociedad - Girona FC

programme.title: Byłem królem
programme.desc: Seria przybliżająca sylwetki najlepszych strzelców w historii piłkarskiej ekstraklasy. To wspaniała okazja do przypomnienia sobie sukcesów Włodzimierza Lubańskiego, Grzegorza Laty, Kazimierza Kmiecika, Grzegorza Piechny i Tomasza Frankowskiego. Poznamy różne piłkarskie pokolenia. W latach 60. XX wieku cztery raz z rzędu królem strzelców był Włodzimierz Lubański (Górnik Zabrze). Natomiast w latach 70. królowali Kazimierz Kmiecik (Wisła Kraków) i Grzegorz Lato (Stal Mielec). W czasach bardziej współczesnych cztery tytuły na koncie zanotował Tomasz Frankowski w barwach Wisły Kraków i Jagiellonii Białystok. Nie zabraknie też historii Grzegorza Piechny, niespodziewanego króla strzelców z Korony Kielce w 2006 roku.

Piłka nożna: Liga Konferencji UEFA - mecz: Jagiellonia Białystok - KuPS Kuopio
programme.desc: Na półmetku fazy zasadniczej Ligi Konferencji Duma Podlasia zajmuje trzynaste miejsce, gwarantujące rozstawienie w fazie play-off. Podopieczni Adriana Siemieńca pozostają niepokonani, ale z ostatniego występu nie mogą być dumni. Zaledwie zremisowali bowiem z macedońską Shkendiją 1:1, a wyrównującego gola zdobyli w dziesiątej minucie doliczonego czasu gry. Przed Jagiellonią spotkanie z KuPS Kuopio, tak jak ona mającym na koncie pięć punktów. Zespół z Finlandii wyjdzie na boisko w Białymstoku podbudowany zwycięstwem 3:1 nad Slovanem Bratysława w poprzedniej kolejce.

programme.title: Archiwum Ligi Europy UEFA
programme.desc: W programie widzowie zobaczą fragmenty pamiętnych spotkań rozegranych w ramach rozgrywek Ligi Europy UEFA. Od sezonu 2009/2010 roku rozgrywki te zastąpiły dotychczasowy Puchar UEFA. Autorzy szczególną uwagę zwracają na mecze z udziałem polskich klubów. Pierwszą drużyną z Polski, która wywalczyła prawo gry w fazie grupowej LE, był Lech Poznań, później sztuka ta udała się także Wiśle Kraków i Legii Warszawa. Największym sukcesem, jak dotąd był awans do 1/16 finału Lecha w sezonie 2010/2011, Legii i Wisły w sezonie 2011/2012 oraz Legii Warszawa w sezonie 2014/2015.

Autorzy szczególną uwagę zwracają na mecze z udziałem polskich klubów. Pierwszą drużyną z Polski, która wywalczyła prawo gry w fazie grupowej LE, był Lech Poznań, później sztuka ta udała się także Wiśle Kraków i Legii Warszawa. Największym sukcesem, jak dotąd był awans do 1/16 finału Lecha w sezonie 2010/2011, Legii i Wisły w sezonie 2011/2012 oraz Legii Warszawa w sezonie 2014/2015.

Piłka nożna: Liga Konferencji UEFA - mecz: Jagiellonia Białystok - KuPS Kuopio
programme.desc: Na półmetku fazy zasadniczej Ligi Konferencji Duma Podlasia zajmuje trzynaste miejsce, gwarantujące rozstawienie w fazie play-off. Podopieczni Adriana Siemieńca pozostają niepokonani, ale z ostatniego występu nie mogą być dumni. Zaledwie zremisowali bowiem z macedońską Shkendiją 1:1, a wyrównującego gola zdobyli w dziesiątej minucie doliczonego czasu gry. Przed Jagiellonią spotkanie z KuPS Kuopio, tak jak ona mającym na koncie pięć punktów. Zespół z Finlandii wyjdzie na boisko w Białymstoku podbudowany zwycięstwem 3:1 nad Slovanem Bratysława w poprzedniej kolejce.
